search_query: Cedar Rapids Museum of Art Cedar Rapids museum
page_title: List of tallest buildings in Cedar Rapids
extract: Cedar Rapids is a city in the U.S. state of Iowa which lies on the Cedar River. The city has a population of 137,927 people of as of January 2026, making it the second largest city in Iowa. The city has 12 buildings which stand over 130 ft (40 m) tall. As of January 2026, the tallest building in Cedar Rapids is the Alliant Tower, which stands 285 ft (87 m) tall. The history of high-rises in Cedar Rapids began in the late 1920s, when a building boom occurred, leading to the construction of the 166 ft (51 m) tall US Bank Building in 1926, which became the tallest building in the city. The US Bank Building was surpassed in 1927 by the 190 ft (58 m) tall Quaker Oats Plant. The city would experience a decline in the number of high-rises being built from the 1930s to the 1960s, however, from the 1970s to the 1980s, the city experienced a second building boom, leading to the construction of the 285 ft (87 m) tall Alliant Tower, which surpassed the Quaker Oats Plant and became the tallest building in the city and the tallest building in Iowa outside of Des Moines. The most recently completed high-rise is the 180 ft (55 m) tall CRST Center which was built in 2016.
